author: d23610c42fc75202b127d0209c09b01f
content:
我是第一次买的p5也是第一次评论 有什么不好的点大家可以指出来：
如果说是对看画质跟画风的，完全可以入一个，游戏的画风很强大，p5也加入了自由对战的pve，而不是以前的回合制。但如果你看剧情的话，真的是跟狗屎一样，第一个因为我以前没玩过女神异闻录系列的 也不知道以前的剧情 但我感觉就是一坨屎，前面的发展基本都是反派被迫无奈的当上了坏人，然后通过三个证物来帮助他悔改，第一次感觉很新鲜，第二次感觉也还行，不过第三次也是一样的剧情我就没绷住，游戏的机制我感觉就是开技能跟强大的普工跟闪避就能过也没有任何难度，如果说让我坚持玩这款游戏的话，那就是我怨种，花了原价买的

什么你妈比烂优化，我他妈几步就一卡，各种掉帧，最后画面直接卡死不动了。
而且，不管这么调设置都没有用，最低画质1080p全屏窗口什么的效果一样，该卡还是卡。
不管你是什么玩法什么难度什么剧情，就这一点游戏体验就屌差。
原本很期待，现在真的很失望。
——————————————————————————————————————————————
十小时后提示我再修改评价
行吧，差评是不会变的。
这么长时间不但一如既往的卡，甚至还会有闪退的情况。
游戏难度设计也很不合理，打小怪是无双，打精英怪和boss直接变成魂like，真就摸两下就死。
再说回来，难度倒也不是什么大问题，顶多我多受点苦。而且可以看出来制作组还是很重视还原原作体验的，这上面的功夫还是可以肯定的。
可是优化这么烂，根本没有游戏体验我真的很生气。
要不是真的很喜欢P5，真的不可能玩下去。

author: 0378c2f9f8615d0f97e9b6edaf21345e
content: Not only does it do a very good job at adapting the mechanics of Persona 5 to a musou format, it arguably one of the best games of the genre. The gameplay feels smooth, fun and intuitive; giving the player very wide array of movement and ways to attack. Each member of the Phantom Thieves feel unique in terms of playstyle. The soundtrack, much like the previous game is absolutely amazing. The dialogue between the phantom thieves is fun and enjoyable. I only gripe with the game is how similar most of the jails feel, generally being 3 prison keeps, 1 trauma cell and boss battle each. Other than that, i thoroughly enjoyed playing the game. Definitely recommended, especially for players looking for a fresh style of musou games.

author: 4937481083a55f3cbe6b8e81ee692a66
content:
I've had a complicated relationship with Persona 5 Strikers.

   Years ago, when Joker was announced for Nintendo's Smash Ultimate, I had no idea just what I was getting into. The art style, the voices, the designs - I fell in love quickly. Upon playing Joker in Smash, I eventually bought Persona 5, and then Persona 5 Royal, and then I bought this.

   Initially, I was so into it. The fast-paced Koei Tecmo ARPG combat was thrilling, with the banger arrangement of remade battle themes from Persona 5. The return to where I spent easily over 300 hours between Persona 5 and 5R, and meeting the cast again.

   At some point, I believe around the middle of the game, I found myself starting to dislike it. To the extent that I actually had to set a motivator for myself to finish it. I made a bet with my coworker that I would give him $100 if he finishes the re-release of P5R on PC before I finish Strikers. That's how sluggish I was, pacing-wise. After returning to the game, I found that I was just under-leveled, and maybe had the difficulty too high. I'm not really experienced with these ARPGs.

There are some segments that are a bore compared to the fast-paced gameplay in the first palace. I didn't like the segments where I had to blindly walk around open areas and talk to NPCs to hear generic dialogue about what's going on, just to progress the story. This being said, those segments are brief, and the rest of the game forward makes that part of the game worth playing through.

   If you've played Persona 5 or 5R like I have, you'll definitely want to play this game. Maybe it won't be your style of gameplay, and maybe it'll take you a while. I don't regret my 43 hours with this game. You won't either.

author: bf1edb294cfe5a62a18d299c2c5c2a5b
content: 喜欢P5的真的可以无脑入！之前以为就是无双，没有剧情，所以就没有买。国庆来了一拨半价折扣就趁机搞到库里了。（结果一周后就打了四折。。）比起本体的回合制，本作打起来真的是很爽快。剧情也很不错（搞笑元素也很多），新人物也很讨喜。（久野美咲的配音实在是太厉害了！）而且本体主要是在涩谷的高中生的日常互动（泡妹），各个时间段都要规划好要做的事。（想起来在PS4上玩P5R的时候，都二周目结尾了还差一个人物的coop没有满就难受。）本作就是一个字，干就完事儿。随时随地可以进异世界打怪，节奏相当紧凑，打完一个boss几乎立马就换地方了，还有本体的很多NPC本作都没有，居然都不带学妹玩的。虽然不至于说是旅游模拟器，不过确实展现出了不同城市的特色（七八个朋友开房车一起去旅行不要太羡慕）。总之目前玩完没有什么大的缺点，和本体是完全不同的体验。就是全成就刷BAND等级有点肝。。

author: a19d335730b15a39899a95d07dd607fe
content:
La música es lo que hace para mí que este juego me llegue al cora. Este fue mi inicio en la franquicia y con tan sólo jugar el primer nivel por así decirlo, me motivó a conocer los personajes y me puse a ver el anime para ponerme al tanto del mundo y al increíble equipo que lo recorre. Unas vacaciones entre amigos, historias entrañables, combate divertido aunque no perfecto, progresión encantadora en la que la tensión siempre llega con buen sabor de boca todo bañado en un jugoso soundtrack que hace a la experiencia única.
De momento me encuentro en negación porque probablemente esté en el último nivel y no quiero que se acabe por lo que alejo los ojos del juego a ver si así me dura más. 
No soy un sujeto muy exigente, pero incluso creo que para aquellos que sí lo sean este juego es sumamente bueno.

author: d9b250fbb9df515c8552a2a7e4be8ed9
content:
トロコンしたのでレビュー

ゲーム性の面では強いペルソナを作る前はアクションゲームっぽかったけど強いペルソナを作ってしまうとR押しながら〇連打する作業ゲーと化します（ずっと俺のターンができます）
弱いペルソナしかいなかったEASYよりも強いペルソナで固めたRISKY（二週目最高難易度）の方がかなり簡単でした

シナリオは個人的に無印がかなりの悪党ばかりでしんどかったのに対して全体的に明るめの雰囲気で楽しめたのでこっちの方が好きです
また、追加キャラであるソフィアとぜんきちがかなり良いキャラなのでその点も良かったです

気になった点は、ファントムムーブが反応しなくなることがちょくちょくあってストレスでした
また、某極みドラゴンを周回している際に数回フリーズしたのでセーブはこまめに取らないとダメでした

アクションが苦手でも強いペルソナさえ作ってしまえば余裕になるのでP5プレイしたことある方にはかなりおススメ出来るゲームだと思います

author: 81292547e527535f8a24fed4d97ca80a
content:
[h1]SDHQ STEAM DECK PERFORMANCE REVIEW (FIRST LOOK):[/h1]

[table]
[tr]
[th] Follow our [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/42495043/]curator[/url] page for more Steam Deck reviews and our [url=https://twitter.com/SteamDeckHQ]Twitter[/url] for immediate updates on all SDHQ content including reviews, news, and more!
[/th][/tr][/table]


[i]This review is based ONLY on performance of the game on the STEAM DECK.[/i]


[h1]The Game Itself:[/h1]


The Phantom Thieves are back to strike against the corruption overtaking cities across Japan. With the crew on summer vacation, Persona 5 Strikers will have you travel all over to figure out what is happening and redeem the hearts of those imprisoned at the center of this crisis. Unlike other games in the series, the gameplay is hack-and-slash, closer to Koei Tecmo's series, Dynasty Warriors, but paired with the Persona charm, it fits near perfectly. Outside of combat, you will walk around the cities and get closer to your friends while talking to them with this road trip vibe. In the end, the game is definitely an awesome and worthy successor to Persona 5.



[h1]Steam Deck Performance:[/h1]


On the Steam Deck however, there are a couple of issues stopping me from enjoying this game. First, the game will only run when using Proton GE, so you will need to make sure it is installed (you can follow our guide on getting it on our website). Next, while it can run at higher graphics settings, I noticed there was still some slowdown. The game can definitely hit 60 FPS, but even when set to it, it caps itself around 58. To fix this, make sure to turn Vsync off as this will push it lower.

The last one is that cutscenes will only play music, not any sound effects or voices. There is subtitles so it is still passable, but it does ruin the experience a little bit if trying to fully immerse yourself. No Proton GE layer seemed to fix this, so if you are going to play on the Steam Deck, cutscenes will be impaired.

Overall, the game is still very playable and can run on the Deck, but there are some caveats. The game is a lot of fun, but with the cutscene issues, it tends to break immersion a little bit. But if you can look past this, you will find a solid experience that continues one of the best JRPGs ever made!

author: 10750e54320b590e866d6ef388358a87
content:
[h1] Sophia is Humanity's Companion!(Best AI!) [/h1]

After finishing it...I felt empty in a feeling of reflection, I put a song on while thinking about it, weeks later I managed to gather my thoughts, AT LEAST FOR ME although the game has a linear single ending, the experience which i received of it is the following:*minor to none spoilers ahead*

This month we had Brazilian Children's Day, why am I talking about this? The overall plot revolves around the childhood trauma of two of the characters. And the way P5S approaches the moral theme of trauma lives up to the series' legacy, the way it handles and showcases how to deal with childhood trauma. 

I reminded myself, regardless of our age, we will always have an inner child, or at least memories from our childhood that profoundly influence our overall mindset. So I loved Strikers Plot, despite the switch from RPG to ARPG, I still recommend it as a good Persona game.

P.S: I recommend getting the deluxe edition for older fans, the music pack  playing in the game with all the music from the previous games in the background ringin' gave a  little nostalgic feeling, well worth the extra$. 

[h1]PROS[/h1]
- Music
- Crosswheel weapons (Rarely do you see this in games+it's in the best char=sophie)
- Zenkichi... relatable char, it's the closest to my usual moral, it was quite an experience watching him grow... he also uses BIG SWORDS "ZWEIHANDER"... (literally me in the soul series)[most unique moveset ingame battles]
 - Cooking and dialogues, the overall camping trip.
- I liked the fact that in this persona we didn't have a villain that was purely evil, just people with twisted goals.

[h1]Cons[/h1]
Grind,grind,grind,grind,grind,grind,grind,grind... i think grind. Well...did i say grind? Oh yeah, grind! 

[h1]Final note[/h1]  
- I would rate the story a 10/10 but the gameplay around 6/7 so I'd give it an 8 for overall fun.

author: 8e1acd4f8d92542e84e07677d61bc202
content:
P5R登录PC前的开胃甜点，剧情方面稍显薄弱，人物塑造太过片面单一，主要还是游戏整体节奏太赶给编剧的发挥空间实在太小，剧情全在预期架构之内缺乏让人耳目一新的感觉，反派的处理方式也是全员悔过洗白（除了经典的statesmen背黑锅），所谓的环岛的铲奸除恶之行也如蜻蜓点水般浅尝辄止，草草的做出几个小的箱庭地图了事。

战斗方面，每个角色的动作和技能做的精致且各有特色，但是后期普攻以及小连招的伤害过低导致后期难度上来后如果没刻意刷属性会导致容错率极低，被不明AOE控住后直接死亡，所以基本上就算动作系统还算优秀但是为了不暴毙只能打开技能面板疯狂的放克制技能然后总攻击，反而变成补给品的消耗战。

总的来说P5S感觉就是A社将P系列ARPG化的实验性质的作品，尤其不推荐讨厌刷刷刷的玩家入手！

卡的问题已经解决：
1、打开任务管理器

4、选择“设置相关性”
5、把“所有处理器”钩上
（每次进入都要操作一遍）

author: 5d03bb2f516453c78357ea21d8bdabb0
content:
[h1]Windows11の方は22H2にアップグレードしない方がいいです[/h1]

コンシューマーでクリアして気に入っていたのでSteamでも購入したのですが、数か月前にはサクサク動いていたのについ数日前に久しぶりに起動したら明らかにカクついていてフリーズしまくりでまともにゲーム出来なくなっていました。

しばらくやっていない間にCPU:Core i7 12700F GPU:Geforce3080ti メモリ:DDR4 32GBの環境に変更した為、それが原因かと思い掲示板や他のレビューを調べてみたらコアの多いCPUを使うとプログラムがコアを使いきれないみたいな記述があったのでProcess lossoを導入して設定をいじってみたのですが全く改善しませんでした。
あと考えられえるとしたらWindows11 22H2にアップデートしたことぐらいなので21H2に戻した所、普通にサクサク動きました。やっぱりゲーミングPCに最新のOSアプデは入れない方がいいですね。

アトラス伝統のコマンド入力式RPGに慣れていてアクションゲームが苦手だったので、初めは敬遠していたのですが実際やってみるとコマンド入力式RPGの操作感に近くてすぐに慣れました。
コンシューマーでトロコンしたのでSteamでも時間があれば実績コンプ出来たらいいなと思います。

author: 60c29660ddf9526b93864829ac1c6a4b
content:
10/10 (sacar el 100/100 toma casi mas de 120 hrs, pero vale la pena el GAME +)
La verdad si vale la pena comprar este juego si eres jugador de Persona, aunque para ser especifica de la 5ta entrega del juego...
El Genero "Musou" o de uno contra miles de enemigos nace en los Japons de asia, para  que se familiaricen, "Omega Force" junto con Koei Tecmo han sido los responsables de la saga Dynasti Warrior, o como yo lo conoci en la infancia cuando me prestaban la Ps2 era Warriors Orochi... (ejemplo que no se vale saltar es cuando Nintendo lanzo su propio Musou de The Legend Of Zelda Hyrule Warriors, juego que salio y jugue en la 3DS y tambien salio un port para consolas)
Al genero y la adaptacion de Persona 5 con tematicas de muchos contra ti... va PERFECTO, no me importa quien opine lo contrario, solo es tenerle paciencia al juego, tiene Cinematicas muy chulas y batallas epicas, narracion pasable y creeible a los tiempos modernos de tecnologia que no sabemos cuando se revalara contra nosotros... Musica perfecta apesar de no estar involucrado "Shoji Meguro", compositor de muchos de los temas de Persona y de Shin Megami Tensei...
Una oportunidad buena de dar putazos a diestra y siniestra iuwui! 
//ENGLISH//
10/10 (getting 100/100 takes almost more than 120 hours, but it's worth the GAME +)
The truth is that this game is worth buying if you are a Persona player, although to be specific about the 5th installment of the game...
The Genre "Musou" or one against thousands of enemies was born in the Japanese of Asia, so that they become familiar, "Omega Force" together with Koei Tecmo have been responsible for the Dynasti Warrior saga, or as I knew it in childhood when they lent me the Ps2 it was Warriors Orochi... (an example that is not worth jumping is when Nintendo launched its own Musou from The Legend Of Zelda Hyrule Warriors, a game that came out and played on the 3DS and a port for consoles also came out)
To the genre and adaptation of Persona 5 with themes of many against you... it's PERFECT, I don't care who thinks otherwise, it's just having patience with the game, it has very cool Cinematics and epic battles, a passable and believable narration for the times modern technology that we don't know when it will turn against us... Perfect music despite not being involved "Shoji Meguro", composer of many of the themes of Persona and Shin Megami Tensei...
A good opportunity to punch left and right iuwui!

author: ccdb4526b1f056459332d7d08bcb6bab
content:
With great pity, I give this a "do not recommend". The major negative aspect of this game is the extremely repetitive nature of the story and the game play. Each "jail" is played out exactly the same way and I find killing enemies is always the same. This is a shame because the sound track is awesome, the attention to detail is great, and the maps are cool. The characters are also interesting and the overarching plot is somewhat interesting.

I just can't bring myself to finish this game. After completing 3 jails, I just don't have it in me to continuously repeat the same mission format over and over again.

author: 2bcc1ae15e2e5432a0f579ac3d81796a
content: A worthy sequel/spinoff to an already incredible game!! The combat is stylish, the music is incredible, and the characters are lovable and relatable. I'd say the only thing I wish got carried over was the Confidant system from the original Persona 5, but granted that is replaced with the Bond Level so I am in no position to complain. I'd say if you loved Persona 5, you will find a lot of enjoyment here. If you are a newbie to the series, I'd say maybe read up a little bit on the story as its a lot to take in without prior knowledge! I'd reccomend this game to anyone who likes beat em' ups and JRPGs. So damn excited for Royal now that it's coming to PC, gonna waste so much time on that masterpiece as well!!

author: 80dfe8659a7656d39aeb36688c98eebd
content:
first off

Do not play this game if you have not played Persona 5 (or Royal thats coming to steam soon)

for the sake of levity i'll try to be brief

this game is great, but only if you love Persona 5

i'll be honest, when i heard of a musou-like spinoff of one of my favourite games ever, i rolled my eyes and wrote it off.
i bought the game eventually, let it sit on my backlog for a few days before eventually giving it a go, and...

within the first cutscene, i was won over.
its important to stipulate that i felt this way because it uses the same story telling methods and writing that the base game provides, immediately making it feel like an extension of Persona 5

and it certainly is

this game provides the lighthearted moments that the base Persona 5 was missing, its lovely, just a damn good time. same great characters, some fun narrative hooks, if you've played Persona 5 i don't need to say anything else

The gameplay is... alright. its probably the weakest part of the game if i'm honest. the real-time battle animations can feel a bit stilted at times, its not particularly complex either, but i had a good time with it overall. you're given plenty of incentive to change up your playstyle and the sheer style makes the game a blast visually.

The Music? ITS LIKE THE BEST PART HOLY SHIIIIII-
when they use a remix of "rivers in the desert" as a prelude to the actual boss theme you know its about to be a banger. every battle theme thumps. theres new battle themes, old battle themes that are given this sexy rock remix, its wonderful. the real-world location themes are also absolute classics, everytime you go somewhere new you'll be tapping your feet for a good while. 10/10 soundtrack, brilliant time.


tldr: if you love Persona 5, you owe it to yourself to play this one, it doesn't treat p5 Royal content as canon but youll be too invested in the game to care. the dungeons (jails?) can feel a bit sloggy at times but everything else makes up for it for the most part. 7.5/10 (presuming you've played persona 5)

author: 975683cd3f1e58a3843bdadb5b2a5569
content: I'm pretty conflicted about this game. On the one hand I love both Persona and DW games, the combat is fun and it's  new take for Persona/SMT games. On the other, there are just too many pointless obstructions. Want to shop before heading to the statue? Can't let you do that. Want to pick up some stuff on way back to camper? Nope, the cat won't let you do that either. I'd also prefer if enemies respawned without having to exit and re-enter the jails (dungeons). Still recommend the game but it has annoying issues which make no sense.

author: ca6854bd06cb5212938f2f5d69d58e0f
content:
As a fan of both Persona 4 and 5, and (specially) Dynasty Warriors, this game is a good combination of the musou formula with the Persona's JRPG gameplay.  Its quite take a time to get a hang of the mechanic and juggle between the musou and the rpg but overall its a fun game to play

Edit: So after playing the game up to near the end game, i can say that the game is very well written, i dare to say the story are better written than the original Persona 5 game, not saying Persona 5 is badly written, but P5S expand from the original game, and the new characters in this game is also good and interesting. 

Gameplay wise like i mentioned it may need a while adapting to, and after playing for a while you maybe have a certain character that you like or hate mechanic wise because each one has different gimmick.

My only nitpicking on this is just the persona fusion... WHY WE HAVE TO LEVEL THEM TO CERTAIN LEVEL NOW??? Though this is minor problem and most of the persona can be fusioned by just the original level.

Overall it is a very good experience, though to completely experience the story you HAVE to play Persona 5 first (either vanilla or Royal as it only continues the original story).

author: a8bd2ab6d9985cbc90c4fb3cd3673145
content:
[quote] ★★★★★★★★用黑色译作背景※用文章谱写铭记☆☆☆☆☆☆☆☆

「点击关注 [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/9619592-Blacklist_//]黑名单鉴赏家[/url]发现更多好游戏 ，点击加入[url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/Blacklistgroup_/]黑名单[/url]」[/quote]

[h1] 《女神异闻录5乱战：魅影攻手》： JRPG怪盗团开着无双打过来了[/h1]

[b] 前言 [/b]

作为衍生自《真·女神转生》的经典系列，《女神异闻录》一直以高水准的JRPG与绝佳的UI设计而闻名。
而曾经与一条魔性的“PS4的新价格”广告捆绑宣发的《女神异闻录5》也终于迎来了英文简称极其容易与PS5搞混的系列外传《P5S》。
就如《如龙7》抛弃了系列游戏的动作游戏玩法改为回合制战斗以外，《P5S》也在本作中将《女神异闻录》系列特有的回合制RPG玩法改为了新颖的无双格斗。但即便如此，本作依旧不会让女神系列的粉丝感到失望。

[b] 买游戏还送番剧 [/b]

作为《女神异闻录》系列的正统续作，《P5S》依旧秉持着系列一贯的绝佳游戏性与让人拍案叫绝的UI设计。
比起A社刚发售不久的新作《灵魂骇客2》，这款早已移植到Steam上的老游戏在剧情演出上依旧堪称一绝，前者作为新作，还在用质量堪忧的3D动画水时长，而后者甚至还为搭配了一套2D番剧作为过场动画。
在剧情设计上，没有前作基础而是完全原创剧情的《灵魂骇客2》让人一头雾水，而有前作基础的《P5S》却让未了解过前作而是第一次通过本作接触该系列的玩家也能看的津津有味。
虽然《P5S》的剧情后期也脱离不了平庸的问题，但与《灵魂骇客2》相比，本作的剧情设计是否优秀就立马高下立判了。

[b] 脱离系列玩法的创新之作 [/b]

一直以来，《女神异闻录》系列主打的就是回合制JRPG。
玩家所扮演的“心之怪盗团”需要利用人格面具赋予的能力，在另一个世界与阴影战斗。
然而到了本作，原本的回合制JRPG玩法突然变成了操作更加爽快利落的无双RPG。这点和《如龙7》一改系列的动作RPG玩法，突然变成回合制RPG的行为恰好相反。
事实证明，这一改动非但没有成为《P5S》的一大败笔，反而恰恰是成功的。
不管是已经厌倦了回合制RPG的玩家还是没有接触过《女神异闻录》系列的玩家，只要从《P5S》直接入手，都能收获不错的游戏体验。
由于游戏玩法的改动，不同仲魔所赋予的回合制大招也在本作中变成了动作游戏中的群攻大招，这也让玩家可以更加直观地感受怪盗团的战斗。
而在地图探索设计上，即便是一款老游戏，本作的设计也比A社不思进取的新作《灵魂骇客2》好上许多。自由移动和二段跳等设计让玩家有了更多的探索空间，游戏性也被直接拉满。
虽然本作的剧情相较战斗内容占比要更大，这样让《P5S》变成了一款以叙事为主的动作游戏，但剧情演出的质量如此之高，也让刚刚接触本作的新玩家可以完全接受这一点。

[b] 后记 [/b]

如果你是《女神异闻录》系列的忠实粉丝，那么《P5S》修改了玩法的表现很有可能会让你觉得不太适应。
但对于刚刚入坑的新玩家来说，一款无双战斗游戏的节奏自然要比回合制JRPG快上许多。
但不管怎样，喜欢《女神异闻录》的你一定不能错过这部质量优秀的革新之作。

author: a6126fbfb7c2553ba091302c5aa5a8a3
content:
You know, all these reviews that are just copypastas and memes(or for this game. pleads of bringing P5R to PC) are getting me sick and tired. What about you hear a real review? I won't speak anything of the story as a. my playtime is low b. youd probably be looking at this from an outsider perspective.

Is P5S worth it? First off, yes. Musou games get really fun once you get the hang of it and all the characters all have unique traits(except Morgana getting a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ weak 1 damage battering ram move. Not cool Atlus.) and once it gets on a roll, the gameplay gets addicting. First off, the first jail is seriously a chore to get through and it may make it seem like there is nothing else to do. But they made the decision to bar all the side studff until you can get to your next jail.

Second off, I said it's worth it But only on a sale please. It may have a good gameplay loop but I find this to be a bit... lacking for its current normal price

Third off, you may need to atleast have knowledge of PS's plot to get the story

Next, the music is amazing and absolutely gets you in the mood to straight destroy

The game also has a semi open world aspect where you get to buy stuff so you can cook or get it ready for use. Also be sure to always talk to your teammates in the non-metaverse map if its a new day. They will usually harbor some loot for you.

Umm... damn writing a long review is hard.

content: P5天下第一

author: 5f5c861a578e5feca3a03cdacf6cd455
content:
[h1]要求スペックを大きく満たしているにも関わらず動作が安定しない[/h1]
[h1]【10/18追記】↑CPUの設定変更で解消[/h1]

【10/18追記】
症状や私のスペックは最下部に記載しています。
EDまで60fps張り付きで快適にプレイできました。
同様に12世代CPUを使っていて同じ問題が発生した方は参考にしてください。

[b]原因[/b]
ゲーム側が「特定範囲内のCPUスレッドしか使わない」設定となっているようで、
この設定を変える事で解消が可能な事例があるようです。
つまりゲーム側がCPUの性能をフルで使えず動作不良に陥っている状態にありますが、
CPU自体は使われていないスレッド分余裕があるためタスクマネージャー上はCPU使用率に余裕があり、問題無いように見えるわけです。
 [strike]ふざけた作りしてんな [/strike]

[b]対処法[/b]
私は以下の記述を参考に本ゲームが利用するCPUスレッド数を変更しました。
https://steamcommunity.com/app/1382330/discussions/0/5241649843390700550/
i7-12700Kは20スレッドありますが、実際に本ゲームはデフォルトでは20スレッド使用する設定となっていませんでした。
全スレッド使用するよう割当てると動作が劇的に改善しました。
（CPU0は主にシステムで利用されるため、環境によってはCPU0だけ使用しないよう設定すると更に安定するかもしれません。）

[b]全スレッド割当て後の動作について[/b]
カクカクでゲームがプレイ出来なくなることは無くなり60fpsで普通に遊べていますが
渋谷や広いMAP等の負荷が大きい所では一部スレッドだけほぼ100%になり、極僅かにカクつきを感じます。プレイに全く支障は無いレベルです。
　→どうも一つのスレッドが100%になり別のスレッドを利用しようとして、
　　スレッドをアクティブにする際に一瞬カクついてるみたいです。
　　P5Sをプレイ中は全スレッド常時アクティブにするよう電源周りを設定した所完全に解消され、今は60fps張り付いてます。

ラストまで行けるかは不安ですが現在動作確認も兼ねてプレイ中です。
EDまで問題が無かった場合その旨追記します。
とりあえずプレイは出来るようになったので同じ症状の方は試してみると良いかと思います。

---------------------------------10/11までの記載、一旦解消----------------------------------
以下スペックでプレイしていますが、頻繁に何かを読み込んでる？ようなカクつき方をします。
数秒止まる時もあり、その際はCPU使用率が一瞬50%を超えます。
小さなMAPでも頻繁にカクつきますがギリギリプレイ可能かと判断し続行した所、
最初のジェイルにて大きなMAPでまともにアクションが出来ないレベルまでカクつきの時間と頻度が悪化し、原因が全くわからなくプレイを断念することにしました。
グラフィック等の設定を下げる、異なる物理ドライブへのインストールやドライバの更新、Nvidiaコントロールパネルへの追加、モニタのリフレッシュレートを60fpsへ変更など思いついた事は全て試しています。
OS：Windwos 10
CPU：Intel Core i7-12700K
GPU：GeForce RTX3080
RAM：32GB DDR4
STO：1TB M.2 SSD

解決策がわかる方がいたらご教示いただけると非常に助かります。
解決してプレイできたら改めてレビューしたいです…
---------------------------------10/11までの記載、一旦解消----------------------------------

author: a0233da3bbd15303a2775320f513a096
content:
・5無印プレイ済み
・ロイヤルが10月にSteamで発売されるため本作を購入

ただの無双アクションかと思いきや、弱点属性を突いたり相手の攻撃を見極めないとすぐにピンチになるあたりしっかり「ペルソナしてる」アクションゲームです。

怪盗ならではのカバーアクションも健在。アクションゲームとなったことで戦闘時、フィールド探索時の縦横無尽感が増しています。

ストーリーも本編からの正統派続編としてすごく良い。和気あいあいとしている怪盗団の夏休み全国一周旅が見れただけでもこの続編を買う価値があります。加えて新キャラ、公安の善吉おじさん、なぞのAI少女ソフィアも良いキャラで、ペルソナ覚醒シーンは最高にアツい展開でした。

author: 621de5e4b50f5f3caf85a1ebedc60f6f
content:
Spent 15 hours tickling feet to grow a better bond between me and my friends. 10/10 gameplay.

Other then that, the port to PC isn't horrible. I had absolutely no issues with bugs or crashes and my PC is pretty meh. Likewise with graphics, no issues. I don't know who came up with the default key binds though but dear God, why? Thankfully, every key can be rebind so controls are not bad. Same with controller support.

Overall, I loved every moment. It's a great follow up from the original Persona 5. Strikers did well giving the series a new refreshing spin. I originally played on release on the PS4. I 100%'ed it there and with Persona 5 Royal coming to PC in a few weeks, I decided to 100% it on steam too. Highly recommended.

author: 8a7fc3a10c6952fa925e057764a91fde
content:
[strike]全画面モードで遊べなくなるバグが実装されているようです。
具体的には、全画面モードでロードを挟むと無限ロードが確定で引き起こされるというものです。
対処法はウィンドウモードで遊ぶ以外になく、それが我慢できない人には購入をお勧めできません。[/strike]

修正方法を見つけました。（探すのに2日もかかったよ...）
①「NVIDIAコントロールパネル」を開く。
②「3D設定の管理」の「プログラム設定」タブへ移動。
③ドロップダウンリストから「Persona 5 strikers (p5s/game.exe)」を選択。無ければ追加。
④「アンチエイリアシング-モード」「異方性フィルタリング」を「アプリケーションによるコントロール」に切り替え。
⑤「適用」をクリック。
これで治ります。たぶん。

P5の正当続編として文句なしの出来。
BGM、ストーリー、戦闘の爽快感（Week、1More、総攻撃、全体攻撃後のカットインetc...）などなど、前作の良いところを完璧に引き継ぎつつ、戦闘がリアルタイムになった...という感じです。個人的にはこちらの戦闘システムの方が好き。

よくこんなことが出来たなぁと感心してしまいます。
前作からオミットされた部分がほとんどないのに戦闘システムの変更に成功している。

ωForceと聞くと無双シリーズの、やや淡泊なシステムを想像してしまいますが全然そんなことは無く、P5の戦闘の奥深さを踏襲しつつ、さらに無双ならではの雑魚敵のワラワラ感や乱舞攻撃（SHOWTIME）に加え、ステルスで強制的にダウン→全体攻撃で雑魚を一掃したり、地形ギミックを使った全体攻撃も爽快。

難易度もEASYにすれば、アクションのせいで死ぬって事はほぼ無いと思います。
きちんと属性相性やギミックを意識すれば、アクションが苦手でも勝てるくらいになってます。
逆に難易度を上げれば、自分でP5の各キャラクターを動かせるって事に感動するに違いない。

P5の超大型DLC（事件解決後の夏休み編追加）って感じなので、アクションパートだけを期待するとストーリーがやや長く感じてしまうはずで、やはりP5本編を先に遊んでからの方が良いと思います。カットシーンを無視できる作りではないです。ただP5と言えばストーリーが本当に素晴らしいので、ぜひ前作から遊んでいただきたい作品。

content:
P5Rが発売決定ということで、
続編も安いうちに買っておこう！ということで
セールになっていたので購入しました！！！！


【プラスポイント】
元々RPGであるペルソナや女神転生が好きなので、
アクションゲームと化したペルソナに違和感が少しだけ！

でもストーリーが面白いですね～、さすがです！
また、ボス戦での戦闘は従来の弱点を狙って
ラクンダなどをかけながら殴る感じで、とても楽しいです！


【マイナスポイント】
①　戦闘がアクションなので、いままでのように
　全てのキャラクターに指示を出すことができません。
　　なのでこのキャラはこういう役割でー、
　みたいなことが一切できません……。
　　また、主人公は出撃固定なのですが、
　他のキャラクターも使い込まないと実績がすべて取れません。
　　そのため、ペルソナを作って使いたいのに、
　主人公を使うことができない場面が出てきます。

②　これはレビューで
　他に書かれている方もいましたが、

　ゲームの推奨スペックを高く満たしているのに
　ロードが挟まるたび、FPSが10程度まで著しく低下します。

　　対策としては、Windowsボタンを押して
　数秒経ってからゲームに戻ると、FPSは通常に戻ります。

　　ただこれが探索パートで発生する分には
　めんどくさいなーってだけで済むのですが、
　ショータイム発動後になったりすることもあるので、ひどいです。


この現象は最近になって出てきているようなので
買いたい方がいたらお気を付けを！

また、直し方を知っている方がいましたら
このレビューにコメントにてお教えくださいますと幸いです。

author: da2544c3ab145abcb8ac695d0a43849c
content: This game is pretty fun! As a fan of Persona 5 Royal, and having never played a hack and slash before, I thought I'd give this a go. As a preemptive warning, this game does spoil the ending of Persona 5, so play that first. Combat can get repetitive as with any game if you play it for long enough, but the Persona flair adds a lot to the combat. The only part I dislike is they bumped the SP cost of every skill in the game compared to its Royal price, and so that made it much harder to regenerate that SP, so you will need to leave dungeons pretty often. Luckily, since this is a spin-off, there's no calendar system to deal with, so it won't affect game play in any meaningful way other than a loading screen. Other people also claim that they are running into performance issues, but I've never noticed any major stuttering or lag at all, and while my PC isn't super low end, it's 100% not high end. If you're a fan of Persona 5/Royal, give this a try. If your a fan of hack and slashes, this game isn't a bad option for you either. Overall, 8/10. Little rough around the edges, but an overall fun experience

author: eaba2c33bf9f5d72980781e12e3892b1
content:
Take your heart
剧情看的比较认真，花了五十几个小时通关
P5S的剧情还是相当好看的，虽然比起P5R来说日常部分是做的很单薄了，城市可以探索使用的区域非常小而且都是用于购买各类药物之类的商品的店家，如果喜欢persona5的话果断入手就当看一部长电影绝对是超值的，正巧碰上打折，我觉得在200左右这个价位入手p5s绝对是超值的，当然如果你本身是不太喜欢看剧情的玩家那么入手需谨慎，我通关时玩的是普通难度（如果不是实在动作苦手或者对于玩法不感兴趣只想看电影的玩家建议别开简单模式），战斗方式还是比较偏向立回的，基本是闪避穿插在技能-one more-技能-one more之间然后再总攻击和show time爆发一波伤害，对于动作游戏而言不是那么有趣。我真的很喜欢怪盗团的故事，想到这可能是怪盗团最后的故事了我还是有点意难平。最后是对新玩家的建议，可以花一点点时间了解一下属性克制和有的属性的特殊效果，游戏还是很鼓励使用克制属性的，玩之前可别去看剧透，这游戏的核心就是剧情，真的是跌宕起伏非常有意思！
最后的最后           再会咯！怪盗团！

author: db7bc8561c9f504baa4af79f6f4282af
content:
DO not buy this mess on pc get it on a console since it wont have denuvo murdering a perfectly good game.
( i am only playing this crap port as i cant get it refunded.)

I have played this game 6 hours and the bugs are sodding many and my hardware is more then qualified to run it
ryzen 5700x
32gb of ram
1tb ssd
2060 super

and still cant get this  damn game to play more then a few hours before it decides holy crap better fall over myself for no reason.

1 .slow down happen in cutscenes with audio
2. cut scenes breaking
3. where the game randomly froze from some text  bubbles popping up to  fast from a bypassering mob random.
4. then it locks up when i try to quick switch into menu in middle of a battle and just flat out locks up cant do crap in the game its just locked up.

if i bought this at full price i would be pissed this game is a bad port and should have been beta tested on a side note unlike persona 5 original the lip syncing for english is all over the place the lips are still moving so this game isnt nearly as polished as persona 5.

its frustrating ive been playing since persona 3 there was the occasional bug but not to unplayable 

update 

( after doing more playing of this game i have determined that on average at least on my rig cpu  sit normally around 32 percent and 52 on gpu.

when the game locks or crashes it pins my cpu to 100 percent usage  the only way i have found a way  around getting out of this lock in full screen is to.

 control alt and delete and choose to sign out of windows to close the program down otherwise it gets stuck on the game. all you can really do is regularly save. The most likely time it will get  locked up is when engaged in large battles or when your doing really quick switching of characters or items.


( update possible fix its running a bit more stable with disabling of the following)

go into display settings/ under graphics/ change default graphics/ turn off hardware accelerated gpu scheduling). this fixed the hanging issues with some games with denuvo running.

author: 2236f4127b3e5e09baebc205c9b57bf0
content:
¿Alguien más piensa que Persona le ayudó a curar su autismo? Jugué persona 5 y soy parecido a el personaje principal, pero en la vida real, así que decidí probar cosas que hizo para hacer amigos y conseguir novias.
Empecé haciendo un gráfico de social links (como en el juego) y anotando mis social links. Actúo de manera peligrosa y misteriosa como el personaje principal y comencé a usar un blazer cuando estoy afuera (compré un pin de la academia shujin).
Estoy bastante lejos en mi social link con las chicas del apartamento de al lado, probablemente 6 o 7 con las dos. También dejé una calling card(como en el juego) para hacerles saber que iba a robarles el corazón. (Sé que en el juego si sales con varias personas es malo, pero tengo hasta el día de San Valentín para resolver esa situación).

Los servidores de Discord son como los mementos, donde puedo sumergirme y debatir con la gente hasta que mejore la visión del mundo de ese servidor. Eso es como el medidor de percepción pública en el juego y también llevo un registro de eso. Cuando llegue al 100% creo que me darán Mod en el servidor.

Básicamente, ¿alguien más hace estas cosas? Solía ​​​​luchar para hacer amigos y solo besé a una chica una vez (no le gustó). Pero después de interpretar a un personaje y verme a mí mismo en el lugar del personaje principal, definitivamente me he vuelto mucho más genial y atractivo.

author: cd11aa690f885bc4ae93485672620069
content:
Playing Persona 5 Strikers is like spending a few hours alternating between playing Persona 5 and playing literally any Dynasty Warriors game, while binge drinking. Then you pass out, have really weird dreams in which the two games have mixed together in your head (much like the Red Bull and vodka in your stomach), and wake up in a fog of confusion and regret. That sounds like it should be kind of awesome, but it's a mess in practice... and worse, actually kind of boring. 
 
This game is only worth it if you're a big fan of the Persona 5 characters and want to see a continuation of their story. I can't really recommend it for the gameplay itself. Like other successors to the Dynasty Warriors games, combat can be fun at first, but gets repetitive fast. Koei did a good job of making the attacks have the same flair and art style as Persona 5, but it doesn't innovate enough, or expand on the usual formula to make it feel truly unique compared to their other games. It just feels like something I've played before, while failing to be quite as satisfying. 
 
Wait for a sale-- a big one-- or watch someone else's YouTube playthrough. If you're a Persona fan, combat is probably going to wind up feeling like a chore to ferry you along to the next cut scene, so give some serious consideration to spectating this game instead of playing it.

author: 177750590b1c55a3a31b77b6b4d8a405
content:
처음에는 다른 페르소나 시리즈와는 다르게 액션게임이라는 부분이 굉장히 꺼려졌었는데
막상 해보고 나니 생각보다 게임 시스템을 개성있게 잘 살렸다고 느껴져서 놀랐다.
스토리는 기존 페르소나 시리즈를 해보고 재밌다고 느꼈다면 이번 작 역시 재밌다고 느낄것이다.
그러나 페르소나를 스크램블로 처음 입문하려는 사람에게는 조금 비추이다.

게임 자체는 입문자나 숙련자나 크게 차이가 없는 시스템이지만(스크램블을 제외한 본래 페르소나는 턴제게임이다.)
스토리를 봄에 있어 페르소나 5를 안해본 사람에게는 5 스크램블의 스토리는 본인이 친구들 사이에서 붕 뜨는 느낌이 들 수도 있다. 페르소나 5를 안해본 사람이라면 스토리를 볼 때 세상이 위험하니까 세상을 구하기 위해 싸우는건 알겠는데 주인공 친구들이 빌런들에게 본인들의 과거의 경험들을 바탕으로 (페르소나5에서 있던일들) 화를 내거나 슬퍼하거나 하는 감정의 변화 요소들을 이해할 수 없기때문이다.
전투는 초 , 중반에는 시스템을 익히고 액션 전투와 콤보를 열면서 ( 원하는 캐릭터로 전투를 하다보면 콤보가 열림 일명 마스터 아츠) 시간 가는줄 모르고 게임에 집중해서 플레이가 가능하나 어느순간 전투에 익숙해지고 속성 약점을 치는게 압도적으로 유리하다는걸 깨닫는 순간 콤보고 뭐고 스킬만 갈기면서 약점을 찔러 상대방 다운시키는것만 생각하는 본인을 볼 수 있다. 뒤로 갈 수록 , 난이도가 높을 수록 한두대만 맞으면 본인이나 동료가 사망하기때문에 액션적인 요소(컨트롤)는 크게 의미가 없어지고 맞기전에 때리는게 압도적으로 중요해진다
 오로지 상대가 공격을 하기전에 다운시킨다는 마인드로 스킬을 갈길뿐..
기본적으로 액션 게임이지만 큰 틀은 기존 페르소나 작품들과 크게 다를게 없다고 느꼈기때문에 턴제 게임만 하던 사람들도 컨트롤때문에 못깨지 않을까 하는 걱정은 없다고 생각한다. 

본인은 모든 퀘스트를 완료하면서 천천히 플레이 한 결과 1회차는 약 30~40시간정도 걸렸던거같고 이후 추가로 최고난이도인 리스키를 플레이하며 총 66시간만에 도전과제 100퍼를 달성했다. 
본인이 스토리를 보지 않는 사람이 아닌 이상 페르소나 5를 해보지 않은 사람에게는 비추한다.
또한 게임 자체 플레이 타임이 긴 편이긴 하나 가격이 부담스럽게 느껴지는건 동일하기때문에 세일 타이밍을 맞춰서 구매하는것을 추천한다

author: e5731b9682fa509b856fb22f6329a251
content:
I skipped this when it came out thinking it was just another Dynasty Warriors clone which I don't hate DW games but they aren't on my "must play" list either. With Persona 5 Royal finally coming to PC I decided I may as well get the rest the P5 story before playing Royal (yes I realize Strikers comes after the original P5 but I still remember most of vanilla P5). And while I had low expectations for the game play it is definitely a lot funner than I expected, most DW games are just mash x a bunch occasionally pressing y, requiring zero strategy, here it is still mainly button mashing but with strengths and weaknesses and with a more interesting story than any DW game. 

Is it as good as the main Persona series? No, I would still prefer the JRPGs but it is still enjoyable. While the social links are missing the story and character development is on par with other Persona games, and while the combat is mostly button mashing on higher difficulties you still need to use some strategy if you don't want to die. 

Would I pick it up at full price? Eh... if you have spare cash sure
Would I pick it up on a decent sale? Definitely, while it may not be the strongest in the series and while it may suffer character overload giving you pretty much everyone day one the story alone is worth the play even if you are not a huge Dynasty Warriors fan.

author: 6a763ae6c5ff5e57a8eaffb3426147d0
content:
[h1][i]"Not having a place to belong sucks, but if you don't got one you just hafta make one for yourself!"[/i][/h1]

Persona 5 Striker (P5S)… I'm not going to lie; I was a teensy bit disappointed when I heard that ATLUS, the developer, released this instead of Persona 5 Royal on Steam. Nonetheless, I decided to give it a shot anyway; let me tell you this – it was the right call! Despite its different approach to the gameplay, it proficiently delivers a compelling experience and a gripping story worthy of being a Persona 5 successor.

[h2][b]Now, about the game[/b][/h2]
[b]In a nutshell, the reasons I'm particularly fond of P5S are these:[/b]
[list]
    [*] Well-written villains that you can sympathize with – they're not all black and white
    [*] Persona stat leveling is a lot easier but requires a bit of grinding
    [*] The new gameplay approach is simple and easy to master
    [*] The new dungeon term was a brilliant move!
    [*] It kept the original Persona 5 aesthetic
[/list]

[table]
[tr]
[th]🙅‍♂️The Not So Good Part[/th]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]During my playthrough, there were times when the game froze. While at times, it returned to normal if I waited it out, most of the time, it crashed and cost me my progress. Additionally, combat can feel tedious, and the spongy bosses do not help. Those are pretty much my main gripe with the game.[/td]
[/tr]
[/table]

[h3]Phantom thieves summer road trip![/h3]
The event of P5S takes place around six months after the bizarre "change of heart" cases in Persona 5; yes, you heard it right, it's a direct sequel of the original Persona 5, not the royal version. With the summer in full swing, the Phantom Thieves are preparing for a small get-together. Well, at least that was the plan. Little did they know that at the same time they were planning their little trip, a different breed of evil was causing another "change of hearts" epidemic; however, this time on a larger scale. And The Phantom Thieves are once again being held responsible by the police for this epidemic.

Along with a self-aware AI named Sophie and detective Hasegawa who believes someone else is behind these "change of hearts" incidents, our heroes will have to scour all of Japan for answers. Simply put, their planned vacation became a trip to prove their innocence.

First of all, mad props to the dev team. It was a brilliant decision to use jails instead of palaces to describe the new dungeons. It gave an entirely different nuance, and I loved it! Especially since the theme is about one's trauma, so the new term is the right call. Frankly speaking, I find the new narrative far more relatable than the original, which is why I prefer it.

The visual aesthetics were the first thing that drew me into this series, and I'm happy to report that, like the original game, P5S nailed the visual aspect with flying colors. The new online store visual was my favorite part; it has this cute animation that plays every time you open the store, and the neat color scheme is spot on, which is a big plus for me. However, while it is undeniable that the visual is a marvel to look at, it can also feel a tad chaotic and confusing, especially when dealing with a sea of mobs since the screen can get a bit too crowded.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2845526015
[h3]An entirely different gameplay experience that feels like a button-mashing fest at times[/h3]
The development was not handled solely by ATLUS. This time, they worked with Omega Force, a division of Koei Tecmo, a company known for producing musou games like Dynasty Warriors and Warriors Orochi. So, no, you won't see the classic turn-based gameplay for which Persona games are known. I was disappointed when ATLUS opted to switch to musou gameplay, as those games are usually a no-go for me. However, despite my dislike for musou games, I decided to give the game the benefit of the doubt and give it a chance – though it took some time before I actually played it. And color me surprised! The game turned out to be enjoyable and fascinating. Omega Forces did an outstanding job of incorporating some of the core gameplay mechanics that Persona games are renowned for.

P5S has eight original phantom thieves members with two new additional casts as playable characters. Each character has a unique playstyle and elements that counter specific enemies. So, the general rule of thumb is to pick a character that works best against that one boss you're fighting or rely entirely on the protagonist's ability to wield multiple personas so that you can counter any situation – I prefer using the latter option. Control-wise the game is pretty simple; every move is a combination of square and triangle buttons – this applies to every playable character in the game.

Hitting the enemy's weakness allows you to perform an all-out attack that'll make clearing mobs much easier, but that's not the case against bosses. To perform an all-out attack against them, you need to break their defensive bar first then you'll be able to perform an all-out attack. There is one teensy little problem, while it works wonders against mobs, it does little-to-no damage against bosses. Therein lies my beef with this game; each of the bosses is so uselessly thick that every time you encounter one of them, all you'll be doing is button-mashing!

A piece of advice that'll lessen your button-mashing experience; always keep a persona with debuff ability in your party! And make sure the debuff is always up.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2847215205
[h3]Crafting your ultimate persona has never been easier[/h3]
The game's not all about hack and slash; aside from beating your enemy senselessly, there are several features to mess around with and try out. As you clear mobs to get to your objective, there's a chance for a random mask to drop, and these masks will net you persona points which you can use to create stronger personas or strengthen your current ones. If you've played previous Persona games, you'll know that leveling a persona can be a long and tedious process, especially when it comes to stat grinding since it involves RNG and a lot of trial and error. The good news is the leveling system is a lot simpler; so long as you have enough persona points, you can efficiently do everything I mentioned. In a nutshell, they traded RNG with a whole lot of grinding. But fear not! as you progress the story, you'll unlock perks that make the grinding slightly less time-consuming.

Now, go crazy and make that ultimate Arsene with maxed stat! Well, at least that's what I did.

Unfortunately, my favorite aspect of the classic game was left out of P5S. They took out romance options! So, if you were hoping for a sequel reuniting the protagonist and the girl of your choice, I'm afraid you'll be sorely disappointed. However, not all hope is lost because some destinations have mini events where you can pick a partner and hang out together. It's not much, but it's better than having no romance segment at all.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2848051549
[h2][b]Overall[/b][/h2]
Despite my obvious bias against musou games, I find P5S to be a solid game and a worthy sequel to the original Persona 5. Sure, there are some bumpy parts that I'm not a fan of, but if I consider the whole experience the game has to offer, I'd say it's all good. If you like the original story, then you will love this one. You should definitely try it!

author: 381f0c60394456018dd8df71b40817da
content:
Finished on PS4, nearly finished on PC. Absolutely loved this game, though it is a shame that we have to wait another month for P5R to make it to PC, its defintily worth the play, the visuals are superb, the story is great and my lord the music is something else, some highlights are: "Singularity" "Counterstrike" "Demiurge" and the new version "Rivers in the desert", there's more but it'd take me all day. Though near the end of the game it does feel a tad bloated, but up until the final dungeon, the game is phenomenal, I love Zenkishi and Sophia, and they both have the coolest fucking awakening scenes in the series.

Feels like an addendum to P5's core message of finding your own path and not bending to the wills of society and taking down those who drag others down. 

Gunna have to finish this again before P5R comes out, which I will undoubtedly put 300 more hours into than I had on PS4.

author: 0a1ad473f0b3510bb6fd23dc255f6904
content: Imagine you played Persona 5 right? Then you beat Persona 5. Now, the perfect end to a perfect game. But what happens if there's a squeal out there, that not only doesn't suck, but also feels like a very proper sequel to a masterpiece of a game? Well, you get Persona 5 Strikers! The entire game is a emotional ride from the moment you start to the time you finish. While not being nearly as long as the main game, about only 35 hours of main game time, with an extra 5-7 of post game content. It's still a fun ride filled with all of your favorite cast you know and love, alongside some new faces. While the combat change was a curve ball for a lot of fans of the Persona franchise, it still has its own charm as a stand alone Warriors style game, while still holding true to the persona combat in terms of SP, type advantages and even the ability to play as each individual phantom thief, all with their own unique play styles and abilities. All in all, it is a very fun game, one that will not let you down, and is a blast to play no matter what genre you're a fan of. So mask up, and get to shadow hunting!

author: 59ad0781ce2e5e58bdefe0c0d3ee6e71
content:
A review from yours truly? You know that means...

IT'S SHOWTIME


Before I start, I'm only recommending this game to people who played or have at least watched a playthrough of the masterpiece that is its predecessor because the story is a continuation of the events prior, and without any form of context, it will severely dampen the impact of a lot thematic subplots that are further developed and used as a stark contrast to what the PT have established themselves to be. Without spoiling, the story is good

In all honesty, this game surprised me.

Whenever I think of a musou-style collaboration, it's always a celebratory piece that stars a large roster of characters throughout the universe with a stylish, albeit repetitive, combat and a jejune narrative that only exists to provide reasoning for the gameplay to be informed. 

But Persona 5 Strikers is more than a spin-off. It's a legitimate sequel, and a wonderful one at that.

I was impressed at how a lot of the aspects of its turn-based, dungeon crawling and life sim were translated into a wholly different gameplay style known for its extravagantly conspicuous and attractive combos with enemies that bolster absurd health pools and the ennui of a monotonous post-game progression. Mind you, P5S is no exception, and if you aren't a fan of musou games, this one won't change your mind at all despite retaining most of the elements you liked about its turn-based older sibling.

Really, what sets this apart from other musou games is the architecture of Jails and towns you visit across Tokyo during your jaunty excursion as an investigatory tourist. Part of what I find appealing about Persona is the interpolation between the mundane and supernatural, which is sadly an aspect that is not handled very well here, for understandable reasons.

It's a bit deceiving from the outset because while P5S has the calender system, social links, time management and a plethora of side activities to countervail the more copious monotony whilst not disrupting the flow of the game are woefully absent. 


These towns are nothing but venues for the story to eventuate. Sure, there's one unique request sent by one of your friends, but they're just glorified fetch quests without much substance. All you can do is just resupply and buy ingredients for cooking and enjoy one social event at the very end of each of them, which is admittedly very charming. The same criticism applies to Jails: I'm thankful each of them preserve the core design of Palaces, but they're sadly repetitive in structure without much in the leeway of imaginative set pieces and gimmicks the Palaces had. They're still undoubtedly enjoyable to traverse through and offer interesting platforming and interactive objects to scurry on over. 

What makes the calendar system even more pointless is the fact it's tied strictly to story progression, which means after experiencing a perilous battle, feeling moribund at death's door, Joker can retreat and chug a can of monster energy and reenter like nothing happened ad infinitum. This a problem because while they translated the turn-based elements into real-time combat adeptly, you can tell this wasn't designed for this style of play in mind. It feels like a frustrating SP endurance during the beginning, and often, I find myself running back and forth to replenish my SP, which feels very disruptive. 

Thankfully, it improves later on, and the combat itself is so endlessly addicting. I loved managing my team, striking weaknesses, debuffing and buffing, mastering my skills, landing all-out attacks, all the while being treated with a gorgeous, almost bewitching UI. Despite the some of the more monotonous aspects, the feedback loop is immensely elevated with a PHENOMENAL soundtrack

Holy shit, can we talk about the ost for a bit?

Why
Did
They
Go
So
Hard

Seriously. Why.

There are great soundtracks, god-tier ones even, and then you have Persona 5 Strikers ost

To put it in MegaTen terms, it's fucking Agidyne

It's so good; even the lacklustre towns are enjoyable to run around in. 

As an addendum, I love you have to EARN NG+. It makes the post-game all the more exciting, which unlocks the infamous Merciless difficulty. Unlike P5R, it's actually merciless. The tutorial might as well be the true final boss because Pixies and Bicorns were more threatening than god

I am mixed about it, though. Merciless, while very cheap and unforgiving in the beginning, feels extremely static in terms of progression because it doesn't matter what stats you or the enemies have, you'll die in 1 or 2 hits.

However, while it rewards you handsomely, Merciless difficulty has quite frankly the most bizarre design choice I've seen for a game's difficulty. For whatever reason, NG+ was designed with it mind because the scale of EXP, money and items you receive is ginormous, and all the useful items are locked behind it. To put in perspective, the spawn rate of Treasure Demons are very frequent, and EXP, yen, items are increased by ten times the amount you'd receive in normal NG+. This makes NG+ an absolute slog for people who don't have the patience for Merciless but want to max their bonds.

Forcing players to adapt to a different playstyle outside of their comfort zone to assuage grinding is a bad design choice. And there's such an easy solution. They should've kept Merciless as is, with all the rewards locked behind it but still have some of the rewards be shared across all difficulties, e.g., an item to boost EXP and Yen or increase spawn rate for TD and skill cards for lower difficulties. Musou games are primarily a power fantasy, so this comes across as a baffling decision

So, to those who feared Merciless before, let me assure you, it's actually very fun after the first mission and possible to manage. Here's some tips for you: 

*Technical damage is your best friend. Not only do they guarantee 1-MORE's to stun-lock enemies, it's a key factor in allowing you to still enjoy mastering combos and using your teammates instead of relying on Joker only. 

*Fuse a Lucifer with soul thief + sleep boost + lullaby + Morning Star. This helps to recover SP because you can spam it on a group of enemies whenever you're replete of it, and the almighty damage, which can't be resisted, will be extremely useful for Futaba's hacking missions

*Use Personas with drain affinities. Null is fine, but drain helps with offsetting severe damage your team will take and allow you to recover health to ensure a barrage of physical skills without much fail.

*With the exception of bosses and dire shadows, and minibosses that null curse, Alice's "Die for Me" can insta-kill any enemy, so abuse it.

*Give all your SP and HP incenses to Joker. P5S doesn't believe in equality, so be a selfish asshole and hoard it all for him until it's maxed. He's the most valuable teammate, so prioritize him first.

*SAVE. PLEASE. Just save at every checkpoint. Merciless doesn't offer the option to retry battles

*For the annoying "stealth" requests without raising the alarm, use Joker and his gun to shoot enemies from afar and save at each checkpoint. There's a massive oversight that allows you to reload your save if you mess up and revert back to that save point without the mission being cancelled.

*Before you start NG+ merciless, use [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ebveWXb_2lU] this video[/url] as a guide to fuse max stats for all personas. One thing that's not mentioned is the fact all the accumulated power is ONLY carried over with the current fused persona, not the registered ones, so make sure to first max out the stats of the Personas in the loop, then register them all, and continue using the current one with all accumulated power to fuse higher tier personas. 

Make sure to have at least 2 million yen and 500 000 pp to fuse your favourite Personas.

All in all, pretty cool game a-

No, I take back all I said. Pancake detective boy is nowhere to be found, so it gets a 0/10 from me

author: 76d65f8f8e7d57d7be264b0072c770af
content:
fun game, lot of good things

[b]Gameplay[/b]

Easy and accessible. 
[list]
[*]First [spoiler]Shibuya[/spoiler] dungeon has questionable difficulty, you take too much damage considering it's the start
[*]Checkpoints in this game are overpowered, as you can use them to save, fast travel, but most importantly leave the dungeon and return with full hp and sp
[*]The game gives you a lot of checkpoints so you can go into each miniboss at full hp and sp 
[*]Game also gives generous hints for boss fights
[*]After first dungeon, I had more money and persona points than I needed
[*]The sixth [spoiler]Osaka[/spoiler] dungeon is also poorly scaled, because the two previous dungeons both only have one map, so you don't get enough exp unless you repeatedly grind
[*]Persona fusion has been simplified, all combinations are preset and you can see them all. Personally I don't like it, but I can see why they might want it easier for newcomers
[*]New explorable areas are all well made! While not as in detail as Shibuya in Persona 5, it makes up for quality with quantity and variety of places in Japan you go to
[*]Achievement completion is straightforward. However, maxing all bond skills is a dull and unavoidable time sink
[/list]

[b]Story[/b]
[list]
[*]Obviously, game is aimed towards fans who have already played Persona 5
[*]Surprisingly, it's not too interconnected to P5, so the story can be enjoyed even if you've never played Persona
[*]No social links, which makes sense. You're already a group of good friends, you don't need to break the ice again. But you can't go beyond that, so you're friendzoned by everyone, no romance for you :(
[*]New playable characters are distinct from other characters and have good chemistry with rest of group. I say distinct, but the outfit of the last member feels too similar and generic
[*]Villains are compelling and well written. They do follow tropes but seeing how its done in Persona's setting is new and interesting
[*]Overall tone and mood are much lighter than Persona 5
[*]Music and visuals are stunning, which is almost to be expected
[/list]

author: 89fa5070616a5fd69f1c6b0289c7e8e5
content:
Persona 5 Strikers feels like a hard game to sell, not because I didn't enjoy my time with it, but because it is a sequel game that is designed to be enjoyed by people who liked the original, but are okay with much of what made the original good being taken out.

Persona 5 was my first introduction into the Persona or the larger Shin Megami Tensei franchise, and two features of the game that I deeply enjoyed were the time management and the confidants. Neither of those are present in this story sequel, which means that there are no real consequential decisions for the player to make. Perhaps due to the game taking place over the course of a Summer road trip, there is no threat of a ticking clock over the player's head. You can go to and from the Jails (this game's version of the Palaces) as much as you like, which means there is no consequence to leaving to refill your SP. Thus, the choice of risking pushing deeper into the dungeon on low SP versus leaving early at the cost of time doesn't exist anymore.

The confidants are replaced by the BOND upgrade tree, which focuses on the friendship you build with the other Phantom Thieves throughout the game. It's as fine as any other upgrade tree in any modern game, but unlike Persona 5 the choices you make don't really matter. You'll have almost everything by the end of the game outside of the raw stat boosts and the biggest additions to it will come from events that happen during the main plot anyway. The confidants added side stories that you were incentivized to see through to the end on top of getting interesting new abilities. BOND is just lacking by comparison.

But, with that said, as somebody who likes action RPGs I still had fun playing the game. It does a good job of making Persona's combat fit into an action system, with trash enemies being easy to dispatch with some attack strings, but the actual demons requiring you to take advantage of their weaknesses to dispatch them efficiently. Naturally there are less playable characters here than a regular Musou game would have, but they all have their unique quirks that make them fun to play in their own right. The story is interesting enough, even if it does start to feel a little like a rehash towards the end. It should be noted that the story of Strikers follows the original ending for Persona 5, and not the ending of Royal. The music is as great as ever, although part of that is due to the game using remixes of certain songs from the original Persona 5 (Counter Strike and Daredevil are absolutely bangers though).

The game also ran on my Windows 10 PC with no problems whatsoever. It's always nice to play a PC game that doesn't waste your time with having to fix it, or having to wait for the developers to patch it to an acceptable state. It just worked.

So in conclusion, if you're desperate for one last adventure with the Phantom Thieves, don't mind going from a turn-based battle system to a realtime action one and don't mind the loss of confidants or the time management, then you'll have a good time here.

Recommended

author: 38d55a749b83518b950affb9aacd0b5c
content:
Great if you haven't had enough P5 or want to mix the gameplay up a bit.
I'm a big fan of the Warriors franchise and didn't really know what to expect with this one, but since omega-force has been hitting the spin off series out of the park lately i wanted to give it a try.

+ new adventure featuring a great cast of characters; the new protag they introduce in this game fits the theme very well and is well executed.
+ they managed to work around the SMT systems very well (chain super effective moves for an all-out attack; MP management in dungeons); the moves have been well incorporated into the dynasty warriors combat system as well
+ espacially on pc the game is well optimized: graphical fidelity is great and more importantly the framerate is stable
+/- less persona variety since they have to work around engine limitations but you have one or two personae per level range and arcana
+/- no time constraints -> depends on how you prefer it i personally like to take my time in dungeons so it works for me
- no replayability
- atlus DLC policies

author: 9e3e8aeebd215f80bce1d5157f9b47d0
content:
Niche game for Persona 5 fans that likes Hack&Slash or just accept gameplay suffering for the MAIN story. Can't recommend to anyone who doesn't complete at least P5. H&S mechanics are fine, but I didn't like them (still better then dancing games). Game definitely lacks polishing and not on par as P5R. Mapping multiple actions on a same button will take you in unwanted situations at least a few times per game, Vertical gameplay just purely bad implements with slow camera, jumps and ropes.
Fighting are OK, but pre-combat scenes are fucked: you enter an empty room, Futaba calls that it's clear on here radars and enemy just raises from nothing and starts talking to you. Why? Just shut-up and fight me, ok? We both know that we can't talk this out. This happens so often that you will get in a big empty room knowing that an enemy will be there. This annoys me from the start and till the end.
I didn't like "original" P5 remix soundtrack from the start. I bought Legacy BGM pack just to add more battle music and don't listen to this. Only after late mid game I get involved with a music because it starts sync with scenes and story. I wished for at least original P5 soundtrack, but you will get it only after completing the game and I'm not going in that rabbit hole again.
Story are good, mostly predictable with a few twists. Sideguest (aka requests) are awful: kill, obtain, secure, crawl. It's just boring grind after fully-featured sidequests introduces in P5 with good entertaining stories. Just skip them, it's not worth it. You can buy a lot of stuff in a shop.

author: 786c012ab97658019157d0785102e410
content:
Persona 5 Strikers is the rare kind of game that's able to both feel like a pleasant surprise and a tremendous disappointment rolled up into the one package, and it certainly makes for an interesting experience to think about. There isn't even really an element present here that feels wholly great or wholly terrible either, it's a balancing act where every idea is on the cusp of either entirely falling off the deep end or being something truly inspired that gets the game as a whole to stand out from the original Persona 5. I'd even go as far as saying that if this game were about 10 hours shorter that I'd think it was an outright great little time, but as it stands, the longer things went on, the more the initially small flaws would build up until it created something that I barely could bother finishing.

Transforming Persona 5's core combat from the more traditional turn based combat into a musou was definitely a creative decision that I was initially concerned about since there have been so many instances where a lot of the strategy a game could have ends up getting removed in favour of button mashing, but it's honestly the thing I think Strikers ended up doing the best as I went on. Despite being a musou by definition, with the hack n slash combat paired with waves of usually very weak enemies, I was impressed by just how much of the dynamics of Persona were still present. While the basic hacking and sladhing will get you through a lot of the smaller encounters, against anything with even a hint of challenge to it, it immediately feels as if it plays a bit closer to a real time Persona rather than a standard game of the genre, with careful team building and full exploitation of enemy weaknesses both playing a huge role in getting you to the stage where you can take things down. To still provide such a strong incentive to be spending like, 20 minutes at a time in the velvet room to minmax your team and make that time feel worth it is very cool to do when the gameplay style takes such a sharp turn and it leads to some situations that really do feel frenetic, yet rewarding.

This is especially true for the boss fights, which were consistently some of the best parts here, often being on the far more tanky side of things, but always feeling as if they properly took advantage of the genre shift and all made for some engaging and intense fights that would more often than not come down to the wire, the final boss especially mixing things up in clever ways that I won't spoil. Adding those additional flashy moves that could be kited around was also a good move in making the choice to move in this direction feel warranted and meaningful while providing another avenue to provide some additional spectacle to things, keeping up with the theme of everything about Persona 5 being so incredibly flashy. That said, things aren't quite perfect either with the shift in style, with certain ideas getting lost in the process. MP conservation might as well not be a thing considering how much more health everything seems to have in this, you're going to either be staying at full MP or blowing it all in a single bigger fight, and it hinders such a core strategic element that could've been fixed just by giving the party way more or it instead of making it a resource that was even more finite than it was in the original game.

The dungeon design was also really bad for the most part, starting off with a couple that were really fun in one way or another, albeit pretty bland from a layout standpoint, but as things went on, rather than building upon concepts that were established and knowing when to add a little twist to them to elevate the experience to the next level, it just was more of the same, but more of it, and far more formulaic. This reached a peak with the 6th dungeon, which was a genuinely agonising experience because of how much unadulterated tedium was thrown towards the player. This sense of repetition carries over to the narrative as well, as while I love the vibes of the phantom thieves going on a road trip and saving the world in the process, after a certain point it becomes increasingly obvious just how many story beats have just been taken from the original and veeeerrry slightly retooled, just with character writing that feels far heavier on the tropes.

In general there's a certain impersonal feel to how a lot of the narrative is executed, villains that are barely connected with the protagonists in any way beyond vague similarities in their strife, everyone just doing their own thing and happening to cross paths along the way, and basically any other interaction outside of the main cast. While this definitely works in some instances to make the world feel more alive and not something that entirely revolves around the protagonists, it quickly leads to wishing that the game would've at least used this in a more creative way at the very least. These 2nd hand stories of hardship and trauma you hear throughout are obviously still pretty dark and all, but without basically any contextualisation to these beyond the bare minimum, it ends up leaving a very minimal impact in comparison and makes it hard to truly get invested in the antagonists throughout, often feeling explicitly introduced to cause conflict without any other purpose.

The lack of this personal element extends out to the rest of the game too, gone is the sense of proper time progression and planning, instead replaced with the game's date exclusively moving forward when the plot demands it rather than leaving any leniency for one of the best aspects of the original game. Things just have nowhere near as much of a comfy charm when you're not spending a lot of your time just, living life and chatting with characters, and not only are all the side characters from the original not present at all, but the social links or any equivalent are also missing. All of this is replaced with this one bar called the "bond bar" which is just an artificial way of trying to evoke the same feelings without putting in any of the elements that elevated this, and like so many other elements just feels like it was included to keep up the surface level similarities. Funnily enough though, despite all my complaints, a lot of this only started becoming truly detrimental near the end once things began to outstay their welcome, and even amongst this painful end portion, the final boss was still a really great time and there were a few other isolated elements of greatness mixed in, not to mention that the game was almost as stylish as the original, albeit less polished.

I genuinely feel like if you're more used to games on the longer side of things that you'll get more out of this than I did, as I'll admit that I do begin running out of patience after a certain point and it probably makes some of the issues present here feel even worse than they are in reality. Still won't affect my own opinion, but I could definitely see others enjoying this more than me as a result. If you're a big fan of Persona 5 and are fine with a bit of repetitiveness, I could definitely recommend this, it still maintains a very high amount of P5's identity while taking things in a different direction. It's not perfect, but you get to see more Phantom Thieves in action and Haru finally is able to get a reasonable amount of screentime too, and that stuff combined with the surprisingly fun combat ends up making this an alright time even if I personally ended up feeling pretty disappointed and bored towards the end.

6.5/10 - Recommended but only if you're a pretty big fan of the OG Persona 5 and wait for it to go on sale

author: 9bec7ac055da5a10a681329eff819592
content:
After coming from Royal, the story felt kind of predictable and unsatisfysing, but that's not to say it's bad. I still had plenty of fun discovering the story behind the jails and the 2 new party members, but that was never the reason why I played the game as much as I did.
The best part of this game is definitely the combat. The satisfying nature or the combos, the insane nuance of the movement and master arts, and the adjustment of the persona mechanics all combine to create an extremely sturdy gameplay cycle with a very high skill ceiling for each of the 8 playable characters.
over the course of the base game, even in hard difficulty I rarely felt like the challenge gave the combat enough justice, but merciless difficulty was a whole different story. Being NG+ exclusive, of course merciless would be difficult but holy shit, some of the bosses put dark souls to shame (although i would've liked the boss to not take an hour and a half).
I can't put all my thoughts into this one review because steam won't let me, so I'll conclude with my recommendation: you should play base P5 before this but it isn't a requirement, hard mode is the only difficulty with any challenge until NG+, and if the combat hooked you then I'd highly recommend merciless, but this game is best enjoyed with full context and played at your own pace.
10/10

author: 371f97701c11549eb610629772b1f9ce
content:
This was a drag to play through, so much unnecessary dialogue and down time. Its a huge turn off from the exceedingly fun fast pace hack n slash and then cut to 3 - 10 minutes of dialogues at each checkpoint.

The writing is not great either, no character development for any of the past members and cheap forced sympathy for the villains. There was tons of needless dialogue, dialogue that could've been summed up in a sentence. Instead they make like 3-5 members of the phantom thieves to give some sort of dialogue reaction like "we're stuck", "oh no", "what are we going to do". But to give credit where its due, Zenkichi's arc and Sophia's are my favourite standouts. 

Gameplay is fun, the typical 'Warriors' type combat with Persona element mixed in and provided mindless enjoyment. The Jails (Dungeons) are linear, boring and mixed with the unnecessary forced dialogue at each checkpoint. It gave this dynamic of clearing enemies for fun and then cut to boring dialogue that last for minutes. The Jails were visually appealing but annoying to play through with lots of backtracking and downtime like unnecessary dialogue and defending Futuba for 3 minutes to move to the next area. The bossfights were fun though, each one had their own mechanic that provided decent challenge and having the option to fight them again.

This is not a must play game, at best your looking at a Marvel movie level of enjoyment in this game. Its no masterpiece and I believe anyone who enjoyed Persona 5 can skip this game.

Edit: *There is no ultrawide support.*

author: 300563b5ac695f08a7f9efee3b6bb0c3
content: Sin lugar a duda, es un Warriors muy distinto a otros, más allá de ser un "bottom smasher" toma los elementos del Persona 5 original y lo adapta a un combate más dinámico y hasta cierto punto estratégico, la historia va muy de la mano a la narrativa del juego base por lo que si te gusto el juego original, es más de lo mismo, por otro lado la banda sonora se adapta a una más de acuerdo a lo que sería un juego de acción, haciendo remixes de los temas original y agregando unos cuantos nuevos, lo cual complementa la experiencia, en cuanto a los visuales, si bien no es sorprendente, el arte junto con un buen manejo del estilo anime, lo hace verse muy único, muy recomendado para los fans, y para los nuevos es mejor a terminarse el juego original o la versíon Royal para entender la historia al 100 %, eso si la adaptación al español ibérico, como es costumbre de SEGA esta muy tropicalizada, pero no esta mal, solo pudo estar mejor

author: f5f318e2769156ff89c36f62381095c1
content:
THE RNG GODS SMILE UPON US

É uma pena que esse jogo tenha chegado na steam antes do Persona 5 propriamente dito, porque em relação a narrativa, ele é uma sequência excelente. É muito legal rever todos os personagens depois de um tempo e mais legal é ver que eles evoluiram, não é um daqueles spin offs que basicamente joga todo o desenvolvimento fora pra começar algo novo. Isso é bem legal.

Eu levei quase um mês pra terminar esse jogo porque eu tava realmente curtindo muito todas as partes de história dele, fiquei realmente bem imerso na experiência, me senti praticamente participando da road trip junto com eles. XD

Não quero falar muito sobre a história pois pode ser um spoiler pra quem ainda não jogou o original, mas a premissa é que os phantom thieves se reunem novamente cerca de 1 ano depois dos eventos do jogo original e acabam se envolvendo em altas confusões novamente com mais um vilão megalomaniaco. O diferencial é que esse jogo se passa em uma road trip onde o grupo viaja por vários lugares do japão. Isso é bem bacana pois a gente vai conhecendo junto com eles várias cidades, costumes, pontos turisticos, culinária e etc. Inclusive tem certas cidades que eles param que é basicamente só pra isso, basicamente não tem ação, é só eles parando pra curtir a viagem.

Sobre o gameplay, é um problema pra mim, e é um dos motivos que eu demorei tanto pra terminar também. O jogo se vende (Acredito eu) como um Musou de Persona que mistura RPG com Musou. Eu fiquei bem empolgado com isso pois eu curto bastante os dois gêneros, mas na minha opinião ele não é nem um nem outro. O gameplay desse jogo virou um amalgama de loucura com character action e rpg que eu não curti. As lutas exigem uma precisão tática que não combina com o combate frenético e muitas vezes eu morria sem nem saber como, pois o jogo também não sinaliza muito bem quando estamos tomando dano.

Fora isso eu devo dizer: A DUNGEON FINAL E O ÚLTIMO BOSS SÃO MUITO BONS!!!

Enfim, apesar dos meus problemas com o combate, se você é fã do persona 5 eu acho que esse jogo é quase obrigatório.

author: ea3fea33fa555d5fa01e4565d97bfe4a
content: An interesting twist on the typical Persona formula. The switch from turn-based combat to hack-and-slash makes fights more interesting, but still leaves something to be desired. The story is unabashedly a rehash of the original Persona 5, making the conflict very uninteresting. However, the two new party members are very well done and enjoyable. Of course, style and polish are the forte of the game. Everything from finisher animations to menu UI is a pleasure to experience. Persona 5 fans will certainly enjoy this spinoff, but fans looking for more substance may be disappointed.

author: 8bb36e24b093550e9795fdee0f82d92e
content:
1) Try to complete Persona 5 before trying this game out otherwise you will end up spoiling yourself somewhat on that experience although it isn't 100% needed it will make the game more enjoyable as its a direct sequel to the base game. Royal is a valid option although do keep in mind the new additions to that version of the game are not considered in this game as it works off the original Persona 5's storyline.

2) Solid game overall. Pretty good flow of combat once your master it and can be exploited rather well to have an easier time even on some of the harder difficulties.

3) Retains the character writing overall of Persona 5 however the confidants have been reasonably cut to make way for bond points (a skill leveling feature for social events and additional battle xp earned).

4) Lower the difficulty if need be since this is not a turn based game beyond the persona skill menu and slowdown when pulling out your gun. Also keep in mind merciless is difficult alongside unchangeable, you do get a fair bit of rewards for struggling on the hardest difficulty exclusive to merciless to help offset how difficult it is.

5) The velvet room has a smaller compendium (usable persona's) which is understandable due to how much development would be needed to make it even larger. However, a glaring flaw I found in this game's velvet room was requiring the base persona to have a sufficient level to fuse a persona (not just the main character's level either) which I found complicated the system needlessly since you either utilize bond points (a new currency to level persona's from either excess masks you collect or releasing persona's you own) or gradually grind the persona up. Usually I just defer to withdrawing a high level persona then release it from the compendium. Fortunately I only needed to do this process a handful of times towards the end of the game to fill out my compendium quickly since I had more than enough money to farm out some bond points.

6) Overall a well done sequel to Persona 5 I found overall enjoyable to play and complete.

P.S. - Try to get the music bundled in the package deal (if you can't I wouldn't splurge on it individually) helped to cut down on too much music repetition and I loved the older soundtracks being included as well in one game (you get to toggle whichever soundtracks you want) and unlock the persona 5 soundtrack when you beat the game! I did not really care for the bonuses included on the gameplay dlc beyond some extra bond points early on to offset some early money woes since you can get everything in the base game all it does is make early game a tad bit easier (early game isn't so difficult that you need to consider those bonuses).

author: fc77484710215330bf16d64b76976527
content:
Slow start aside, this is what I wanted from Persona 5. 
I thought the original game was good but very flawed in matters of story, characters and setting. Some of the themes just never connected, the social links varied wildly in how good they were (most got ruined by including boss fights in the end), and overall the story and villains felt weak, cartoonish, and juvenile.

Persona 5 Strikers is a do-over. After the second dungeon the game opens up and goes mask-off about being  P5 without the rewrites and crunch to finish. And it's *really* good at being Persona 5. I now enjoy this side of the franchise way more, love all the characters and would be super down to see them again.

Added to being a superior telling of P5's story, it's also just a great action game. It's not perfect, some mechanics could have used some polishing, but I had a blast with it. I really really beg of you to continue after the second castle -- it is the weakest part of the game and could be completely taken out and it wouldn't change much. Game starts from the third castle onward and never lets up. 

I'd recommend this to anyone who kinda enjoyed P5, and people who want a cool action game to spend a long time with.

人格面具内容丰富，培养系统有趣，凹p不算难。
游戏流程长，关卡设计合理，人设精美，塑造全面，配音优秀，剧情瑕不掩瑜，中二恰到好处，新加的成员还不错。

- No Persona's only DLC for this one.
- Easiest Persona 5 game to 100% trophies.
- New meaningful and playable characters.
- Noticeably less dialogue and less playtime (just by a few though, almost unnoticeable).
- The universe expands above what we're already seen in P5 and P5R.
- Bond system is different that its predecessor.
- Still a time consuming game
- Ost still as funky as ever ahah.

2) It's your first Persona 5 game : (dance in starlight not included)
- You might not understand certains things that happened in Vanilla P5 and P5R.
- Still a time consuming game
- Ost still as funky as ever ahah.
